iaik.utils

Class ExtByteArrayOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream
        • iaik.utils.ExtByteArrayOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class ExtByteArrayOutputStream
extends java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream
    An extended version of the ByteArrayOutputStream. It supports two additional methods:
    • getInternalByteArray(), which is the byte array used internally. Note that it will generally be larger than the amount of data written to it, it may not be modified, and that it may become invalid after further write calls.
    • getInputStream() that returns a ByteArrayInputStream reading from the data written to this OutputStream.
        The advantage to the standard ByteArrayOutputStream is that the data does not have to be copied, which costs time and temporarily twice the memory usage.

      • getInputStream

        public java.io.ByteArrayInputStream getInputStream()
        Gets a ByteArrayInputStream from which to read the data of the internal buffer. The data is read from the original internal buffer without copying.
